##

CVE-2024-43477
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-23T03:31:07

2 posts

Improper access control in Decentralized Identity Services allows an unathenticated attacker to disable Verifiable ID's on another tenant.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##

CVE-2024-22243
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-22T18:59:24

2 posts

Applications that use UriComponentsBuilder to parse an externally provided URL (e.g. through a query parameter) AND perform validation checks on the host of the parsed URL may be vulnerable to a open redirect attack or to a SSRF attack if the URL is used after passing validation checks.

2 repos

https://github.com/shellfeel/CVE-2024-22243-CVE-2024-22234

https://github.com/SeanPesce/CVE-2024-22243

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-43033
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-22T18:31:22

2 posts

JPress through 5.1.1 on Windows has an arbitrary file upload vulnerability that could cause arbitrary code execution via ::$DATA to AttachmentController, such as a .jsp::$DATA file to io.jpress.web.commons.controller.AttachmentController#upload. NOTE: this is unrelated to the attack vector for CVE-2024-32358.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-02T14:22:08.324Z ##

When it comes to a vulnerability's exploitability, a proof of concept being disclosed increases those odds. Does every CVE with a PoC get exploited? Definitely not. In this case however, a cybercriminal recently shared a Proof of Concept (PoC) on a dark web forum for CVE-2024-43044, a Jenkins server arbitrary file read vulnerability (See parent toot above for the security advisory). Threat actors talking about exploiting a vulnerability adds a bit more weight to the exploitability odds.

There's a technical analysis and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-43044 if you wanted to learn more.

cc: @todb

#jenkins #CVE_2024_43033 #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-02T14:22:08.000Z ##

When it comes to a vulnerability's exploitability, a proof of concept being disclosed increases those odds. Does every CVE with a PoC get exploited? Definitely not. In this case however, a cybercriminal recently shared a Proof of Concept (PoC) on a dark web forum for CVE-2024-43044, a Jenkins server arbitrary file read vulnerability (See parent toot above for the security advisory). Threat actors talking about exploiting a vulnerability adds a bit more weight to the exploitability odds.

There's a technical analysis and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-43044 if you wanted to learn more.

cc: @todb

CVE-2024-28987
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-22T12:48:02.790000

12 posts

The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

jbhall56 at 2024-08-24T13:03:04.476Z ##

The disclosure of CVE-2024-28987 means that, in two weeks, there have been two critical bugs and corresponding patches for SolarWinds' less-often-discussed IT help desk software. https://www.darkreading.com/remote-workforce/patch-now-second-solarwinds-critical-bug-in-web-help-desk

##
jbhall56 at 2024-08-23T11:19:32.614Z ##

The enterprise software maker warns that the hardcoded credential blunder, which was assigned CVE-2024-28987, with a CVSS score of 9.1, could allow a “remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data”. https://www.securityweek.com/solarwinds-leaks-credentials-in-hotfix-for-exploited-web-help-desk-flaw/

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-23T10:35:04.000Z ##

Another critical SolarWinds Web Help Desk bug fixed (CVE-2024-28987) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/23/cve-2024-28987/ #vulnerability #enterprise #SolarWinds #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #News #SMBs #CVE #MSP

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-08-22T18:28:38.000Z ##

"The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data."

https://www.solarwinds.com/trust-center/security-advisories/cve-2024-28987

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T16:56:49.608Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: Web Help Desk Hardcoded Credential Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28987)
Here we go again, another SolarWinds Web Help Desk vulnerability. I promise you this one is different:
CVE-2024-28987 (9.1 critical) The SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) software is affected by a hardcoded credential vulnerability, allowing remote unauthenticated user to access internal functionality and modify data.

No mention of exploitation. Discovered by Zach Hanley, while not listed, is part of Horizon3. He indicated at the Bad Place that he will post a technical writeup next month. Stay tuned.

#SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28987 #cve #webhelpdesk

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-08-22T16:54:30.000Z ##

SolarWinds has released a critical patch for CVE-2024-28987 in its Web Help Desk software. Users are advised to update immediately to prevent unauthorized access and data modification. Stay vigilant and update your systems promptly. #cybersecurity #infosec

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T14:40:38.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Super hot off the press!!! NOTE: I'm so quick that CISA hasn't even started the blog post yet, generating a Page Not Found page. I have it on good authority that the following are added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

  • CVE-2021-33044 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-33045 (9.8 critical) Dahua IP Camera Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-0185 (8.4 high) Linux Kernel Heap-Based Buffer Overflow
  • CVE-2021-31196 (7.2 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Information Disclosure Vulnerability

Edit: Until that link works above, or someone corrects me, heres's a link to CISA's KEV Catalog

Multiple vulnerabilities in the REST API of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct blind SQL injection attacks. A successful exploit could allow the

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T16:12:40.117Z ##

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T16:12:40.117Z ##

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #cve

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-28000
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-21T15:31:00

3 posts

Incorrect Privilege Assignment vulnerability in LiteSpeed Technologies LiteSpeed Cache litespeed-cache allows Privilege Escalation.This issue affects LiteSpeed Cache: from 1.9 through 6.3.0.1.

3 repos

https://github.com/Alucard0x1/CVE-2024-28000

https://github.com/arch1m3d/CVE-2024-28000

https://github.com/ebrasha/CVE-2024-28000

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-22T09:40:02.000Z ##

Une faille critique dans LiteSpeed Cache expose des millions de sites WordPress https://www.it-connect.fr/faille-critique-litespeed-cache-expose-des-millions-de-sites-wordpress-cve-2024-28000/ #ActuCybersécurité #Cybersécurité #Vulnérabilité #Wordpress #Web

##
ottoto2017@prattohome.com at 2024-08-22T05:08:27.000Z ##

「Litespeed キャッシュのバグにより、数百万の WordPress サイトが乗っ取り攻撃にさらされる 」： BLEEPINGCOMPUTER

「LiteSpeed Cache WordPress プラグインの重大な脆弱性により、攻撃者が不正な管理者アカウントを作成した後、数百万の Web サイトを乗っ取る可能性があります。

LiteSpeed Cache はオープンソースで最も人気のある WordPress サイト高速化プラグインで、500 万以上のアクティブなインストールがあり、WooCommerce、bbPress、ClassicPress、Yoast SEO をサポートしています。

認証されていない権限昇格の脆弱性 ( CVE-2024-28000 ) は、プラグインのユーザー シミュレーション機能で見つかりました。バージョン 6.3.0.1 までの LiteSpeed Cache の弱いハッシュ チェックが原因で発生します。 」

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/litespeed-cache-bug-exposes-millions-of-wordpress-sites-to-takeover-attacks/

#prattohome #BLEEPINGCOMPUTER

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-08-22T09:40:02.000Z ##

CVE-2024-6800(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

9 posts

An XML signature wrapping vulnerability was present in GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) when utilizing SAML authentication with specific identity providers. This vulnerability allowed an attacker with direct network access to GitHub Enterprise Server to forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user with site administrator privileges. Exploitation of this vulnerability would allow

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:40:53.030Z ##

GitHub security advisories from 20 August 2024:

  • Enterprise Server 3.10.16
  • Enterprise Server 3.11.14
  • Enterprise Server 3.12.8
  • Enterprise Server 3.13.3

The big one is CVE-2024-6800 (9.5 critical):

On GitHub Enterprise Server instances that use SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication with specific IdPs utilizing publicly exposed signed federation metadata XML, an attacker could forge a SAML response to provision and/or gain access to a user account with site administrator privileges.

No mention of exploitation. h/t to Qualys: GitHub Patches Multiple Security Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-6800, CVE-2024-6337, & CVE-2024-7711)

#cve #vulnerability #github #PatchTuesday

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

2 posts

An Incorrect Authorization vulnerability was identified in GitHub Enterprise Server that allowed a GitHub App with only content: read and pull_request_write: write permissions to read issue content inside a private repository. This was only exploitable via user access token and installation access token was not impacted. This vulnerability affected all versions of GitHub Enterprise Server prior to

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

2 posts

An Incorrect Authorization vulnerability was identified in GitHub Enterprise Server, allowing an attacker to update the title, assignees, and labels of any issue inside a public repository. This was only exploitable inside a public repository. This vulnerability affected GitHub Enterprise Server versions before 3.14 and was fixed in versions 3.13.3, 3.12.8, and 3.11.14. Versions 3.10 of GitHub Ent

##

CVE-2024-38175
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-20T21:30:42

1 posts

An improper access control vulnerability in the Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra allows an authenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T18:55:08.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-38175
CVE-2024-38175 (9.6 critical) Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CWE-284: Improper Access Control)

An attacker with permissions to deploy User Defined Functions (UDF) in an Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra cluster can send specially crafted requests to the underlying host and extract credentials for managed identities of other clusters on the same host node. The compromised credentials enable the attacker to impersonate the victim's managed identity and retrieve information from other clusters hosted on the node which could be outside of the attacker's tenant.
The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38175 #Azure #ApacheCassandra #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-43399
(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-20T18:44:48

2 posts

### Summary Upon reviewing the MobSF source code, I identified a flaw in the Static Libraries analysis section. Specifically, during the extraction of .a extension files, the measure intended to prevent Zip Slip attacks is improperly implemented. Since the implemented measure can be bypassed, the vulnerability allows an attacker to extract files to any desired location within the server running M

screaminggoat at 2024-08-27T11:35:00.126Z ##

Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB): Warning: Critical Vulnerability in Mobile Security Framework can Lead to Remote Code Execution, Patch Immediately!
Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. CCB warns that a proof of concept exists for CVE-2024-43399 (9.8 critical, disclosed 19 August 2024) a faulty implementation in preventing Zip Slip attacks allows for arbitrary file overwrite and resulting in remote code execution.

When the application scans a malicious file with the “.a” extension, it allows files to be extracted to any location on the server were the application is running. This can overwrite any existing file on the server and subsequently lead to Remote Code Execution.

#CVE_2024_43399 #MobSF #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-27T11:35:00.000Z ##

Centre for Cybersecurity Belgium (CCB): Warning: Critical Vulnerability in Mobile Security Framework can Lead to Remote Code Execution, Patch Immediately!
Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is a pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis. CCB warns that a proof of concept exists for CVE-2024-43399 (9.8 critical, disclosed 19 August 2024) a faulty implementation in preventing Zip Slip attacks allows for arbitrary file overwrite and resulting in remote code execution.

When the application scans a malicious file with the “.a” extension, it allows files to be extracted to any location on the server were the application is running. This can overwrite any existing file on the server and subsequently lead to Remote Code Execution.

#CVE_2024_43399 #MobSF #vulnerability #cve #proofofconcept #poc

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.12%

updated 2024-08-20T18:00:43

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

threatcodex at 2024-08-22T14:06:03.506Z ##

The Hidden Door: How CVE-2024-23897 Enabled Ransomware Attack on Indian Banks
#CVE_2024_23897
https://blogs.juniper.net/en-us/threat-research/cve-2024-23897-enabled-ransomware-attack-on-indian-banks

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.000Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 7.6, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to

##

CVE-2024-25157
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-19T21:35:08

2 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 allows Admin Users with access to the Agent Console to circumvent some permission checks when attempting to visit other pages. This could lead to unauthorized information disclosure or modification.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T18:59:02.869Z ##

Fortra security advisories:

  • GoAnywhere MFT (from 14 August 2024): Authentication bypass in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 CVE-2024-25157 (6.5 medium)
  • FileCatalyst (from 27 August 2024):
    • Insecure Default in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) (9.8 critical) default credentials are published in a vendor knowledgebase article
    • SQL Injection in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) CVE-2024-6632 (7.2 high)

No mention of exploitation. But shame on FileCatalyst for having hardcoded credentials. See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Fortra fixes critical FileCatalyst Workflow hardcoded password issue

#fortra #filecatalyst #goanywhere #cve #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-28T18:59:02.000Z ##

  • GoAnywhere MFT (from 14 August 2024): Authentication bypass in GoAnywhere MFT prior to 7.6.0 CVE-2024-25157 (6.5 medium)
  • FileCatalyst (from 27 August 2024):
    • Insecure Default in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) (9.8 critical) default credentials are published in a vendor knowledgebase article
    • SQL Injection in FileCatalyst Workflow 5.1.6 Build 139 (and earlier) CVE-2024-6632 (7.2 high)

##

CVE-2024-38063
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-16T20:54:12.043000

38 posts

Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

18 repos

decio at 2024-08-28T06:36:15.848Z ##

[Related to CVE-2024-38063 ]

PoC
👇
https://infosec.exchange/@ynwarcs/113018607529748855

Technical deep-dive
👇
https://infosec.exchange/@malwaretech/113032726284286625

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063 #PoC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T17:35:53.945Z ##

SonicWall: Understanding CVE-2024-38063: How SonicWall Prevents Exploitation
SonicWall also performed patch diffing for CVE-2024-38063, and reached a similar conclusion to farmpoet (see parent toot above): "the patch was added to the Ipv6pProcessOptions function."

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

cc: @wdormann @mttaggart @GossiTheDog in case anyone is still interested in CVE-2024-38063 analysis.

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket #rca

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.474Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... But what we've seen so far illustrates a very important point. That the vulnerability can't be triggered with a single packet. In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

Read the whole thread with the technical jargon if you can't understand my summary. His take is that 9.8 severity is overblown because "at best we're talking about a remote denial of service and full RCE is intractable in this case."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-28T06:36:15.000Z ##

[Related to CVE-2024-38063 ]

PoC
👇
https://infosec.exchange/@ynwarcs/113018607529748855

Technical deep-dive
👇
https://infosec.exchange/@malwaretech/113032726284286625

#CyberVeille #CVE_2024_38063 #PoC

The additional, conditional logic in the updated version introduces checks before executing IppSendErrorList. The vulnerability takes advantage of an out-of-bound write (OOB) by sending malformed Ipv6 packets. It forces packets to be written to an error list called IppSendErrorList to obtain the correct conditions. The new checks only add packets to the list after the data is validated. Otherwise, it only sends an error without adding the packets to the list memory structure. The patch prevents unintended behavior or exploitation by ensuring that the functions IppSendError or IppSendErrorList are only called under appropriate conditions, reducing the risk of incorrect or malicious data being processed. This indicates that the vulnerable code likely still exists but is more complicated or potentially impossible to leverage.

##
axels@mastodon.social at 2024-08-21T16:58:10.000Z ##

PSA: Bad bug in #Windows update! Turn off IPv6 and update #CVE202438063

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38063

This is a zero click vulnerability, meaning you are vulnerable and don't need to click on anything to get exploited.

If you run Windows and have #IPv6, please turn it off. You need these updates to address the bug:

https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571

#CyberSecurity

screaminggoat at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.474Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:25:43.000Z ##

farmpoet has perhaps the best technical analysis (in a threaded conversation at the Bad Place ) of CVE-2024-38063 (9.8 critical) Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability.
farmpoet notes that tcpip.sys kernel driver got an update during Patch Tuesday. After performing binary diffing, they narrowed it down to IppSendErrorList() and two possible code paths: Ipv6pValidateNetBuffer and Ipv6pReceiveDestinationOptions

Ipv6 doubled the header size compared to ipv4 so optional data needs to be provided in extension headers to avoid further bloat. A quick read at RFC 8200 gives us a list of possible extension headers.

farmpoet notes that "ipv6 has a feature which allows the sender to request the packet to be discarded and a notification to be sent back if the destination doesn't know how to handle a specific option."

the function receives a _NET_BUFFER_LIST.
The first field of that struct is a pointer to the next _NET_BUFFER it contains.
So IppSendErrorList just iterates through that single linked list until all packets in that _NET_BUFFER_LIST have been processed.

"At this point I dare to speculate the vulnerability may possibly be triggered by specially crafting packets which will cause an incorrect parsing by IppSendError... In fact, you'll have to flood the destination with packets just to reach the vulnerable path."

#CVE_2024_38063 #IPv6 #vulernability #cve #Microsoft #speciallycraftedpacket

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-30T23:30:54.362Z ##

For a couple of years now I've been trying to assess the likelihood of critical Windows CVEs being mass exploited by reverse engineering the patches for them. A lot of the time, even after figuring out exactly how the vulnerability works, and how to exploit it, the answer is: I simply don't know.

There are so many variables involved, and it usually comes down to whether some security researcher is going to be an asshole by dumping full functional exploit code onto GitHub. For CVE-2024-38063, the bug has all the pieces needed to build a full RCE exploit, but the exploit trigger is contingent on certain network adapter behavior, and possibly also the driver's interrupt timer behavior, neither of which I know much about.

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-30T23:14:23.493Z ##

Wanted to share my thread about vulnerability scoring and overhyping vulnerabilities here too. It primarily stemmed from the discussion about whether CVE-2024-38063 was overhyped or not, but I think it translates well to vulnerability scoring in general.

Many people like to blame vendors or shortcomings in CVSS for overhyping vulnerabilities, but a lot of the time it's just that vulnerability scoring is really really difficult, especially for memory corruption vulnerabilities.

On a technical level, it's hard to know whether a memory corruption is practically and reliably exploitable. Whilst the person who discovered it may not have a stable exploit, someone could later come along and find a different technique that makes the exploit code infinitely more reliable.

Even in cases where a very severe vulnerability is reliably exploitable, widespread exploitation isn't guaranteed. Due to the mechanics of the cybercrime economy, there are very few skilled exploit developers on that side of things. Most of the high caliber vulnerability researchers are either doing cybersecurity work, or selling CNE capabilities to governments.

As a result, a lot of n-day exploitation is going to be low-level targeted attacks by state-sponsored threat actors, rather than indiscriminate mass exploitation by cybercriminals. To many outsiders, it may even appear as if a vulnerability never got picked up and exploited at all. The only people who are going to know any different are the unlucky chosen ones who got targeted.

The five alarm fires, which many of these dire warnings like "this vulnerability is wormable" and "drop everything & patch now" seek to avoid, are near impossible to predict in reality. The WannaCrys, and the BlueKeeps usually have external aggravating factors. In both cases, this was fully function exploit code being released publicly. Most threat actors don't have top-tier exploit development capabilities, but every single one of them can use Google.

The difference between a typical cybersecurity incident and the worst ransomware attack the world has ever seen, can be as simple as one person's decision to publish exploit code. Nobody has a crystal ball to tell if or when that might happen, but by the time it does, it's way too late to start issuing warnings.

So if you're feeling frustrated having to drop everything to patch yet another nothing-burger CVSS 9.0+ vulnerability, just remember that the decision of a single individual can quickly turned that nothing-burger into a threat actor spray & pray free-for-all.

##
briankrebs at 2024-08-30T20:06:05.361Z ##

FYI, an exploit has been released for the zero-click IPv6 vulnerability that Microsoft patched this month in Win 10/11/Server systems. The SANS Internet Storm Center says the released exploit code will cause vulnerable systems to crash, but unreliably.

Chances are decent that some smart people are working on more reliable exploits against this flaw, perhaps even those that actually achieve code execution. Probably best to patch this one soon if you haven't already for some reason.

Further reading (the SANS bit was from their email newsletter):
https://www.theregister.com/2024/08/28/proofofconcept_code_released_for_zeroclick/?is=1ef7934f6635b02395adcab09a0c1b24bf0ea745b648bfe87189de8aadc7300b

https://malwaretech.com/2024/08/exploiting-CVE-2024-38063.html

##
Sempf at 2024-08-30T03:33:59.343Z ##

Anyone played with this MS IPv6 bug POC? I don't know a lot about the network stack, being mostly a web guy, but the code is nice and elegant.

https://github.com/ynwarcs/CVE-2024-38063/tree/main

#microsoft #poc

decio at 2024-08-29T15:10:42.483Z ##

I'm totally into this phrasing by the Reg
⬇️
𝓘𝓯 𝔂𝓸𝓾 𝓱𝓪𝓿𝓮𝓷'𝓽 𝓭𝓮𝓹𝓵𝓸𝔂𝓮𝓭 𝓐𝓾𝓰𝓾𝓼𝓽'𝓼 𝓹𝓪𝓽𝓬𝓱𝓮𝓼, 𝓰𝓮𝓽 𝓫𝓾𝓼𝔂 𝓫𝓮𝓯𝓸𝓻𝓮 𝓸𝓽𝓱𝓮𝓻𝓼 𝓭𝓸

(Proof-of-concept code released for zero-click critical Windows vuln)
👇
https://www.theregister.com/2024/08/28/proofofconcept_code_released_for_zeroclick/

.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
(𝘖𝘳 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘐𝘗𝘷6—𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥𝘴 𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘯 4 𝘣𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘐𝘗 𝘢𝘥𝘥𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘺𝘸𝘢𝘺?) :troll:

##
malwaretech@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T23:30:54.000Z ##

For a couple of years now I've been trying to assess the likelihood of critical Windows CVEs being mass exploited by reverse engineering the patches for them. A lot of the time, even after figuring out exactly how the vulnerability works, and how to exploit it, the answer is: I simply don't know.

There are so many variables involved, and it usually comes down to whether some security researcher is going to be an asshole by dumping full functional exploit code onto GitHub. For CVE-2024-38063, the bug has all the pieces needed to build a full RCE exploit, but the exploit trigger is contingent on certain network adapter behavior, and possibly also the driver's interrupt timer behavior, neither of which I know much about.

##
malwaretech@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T23:14:23.000Z ##

Wanted to share my thread about vulnerability scoring and overhyping vulnerabilities here too. It primarily stemmed from the discussion about whether CVE-2024-38063 was overhyped or not, but I think it translates well to vulnerability scoring in general.

Many people like to blame vendors or shortcomings in CVSS for overhyping vulnerabilities, but a lot of the time it's just that vulnerability scoring is really really difficult, especially for memory corruption vulnerabilities.

On a technical level, it's hard to know whether a memory corruption is practically and reliably exploitable. Whilst the person who discovered it may not have a stable exploit, someone could later come along and find a different technique that makes the exploit code infinitely more reliable.

Even in cases where a very severe vulnerability is reliably exploitable, widespread exploitation isn't guaranteed. Due to the mechanics of the cybercrime economy, there are very few skilled exploit developers on that side of things. Most of the high caliber vulnerability researchers are either doing cybersecurity work, or selling CNE capabilities to governments.

As a result, a lot of n-day exploitation is going to be low-level targeted attacks by state-sponsored threat actors, rather than indiscriminate mass exploitation by cybercriminals. To many outsiders, it may even appear as if a vulnerability never got picked up and exploited at all. The only people who are going to know any different are the unlucky chosen ones who got targeted.

The five alarm fires, which many of these dire warnings like "this vulnerability is wormable" and "drop everything & patch now" seek to avoid, are near impossible to predict in reality. The WannaCrys, and the BlueKeeps usually have external aggravating factors. In both cases, this was fully function exploit code being released publicly. Most threat actors don't have top-tier exploit development capabilities, but every single one of them can use Google.

The difference between a typical cybersecurity incident and the worst ransomware attack the world has ever seen, can be as simple as one person's decision to publish exploit code. Nobody has a crystal ball to tell if or when that might happen, but by the time it does, it's way too late to start issuing warnings.

So if you're feeling frustrated having to drop everything to patch yet another nothing-burger CVSS 9.0+ vulnerability, just remember that the decision of a single individual can quickly turned that nothing-burger into a threat actor spray & pray free-for-all.

##
briankrebs@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T20:06:05.000Z ##

FYI, an exploit has been released for the zero-click IPv6 vulnerability that Microsoft patched this month in Win 10/11/Server systems. The SANS Internet Storm Center says the released exploit code will cause vulnerable systems to crash, but unreliably.

Chances are decent that some smart people are working on more reliable exploits against this flaw, perhaps even those that actually achieve code execution. Probably best to patch this one soon if you haven't already for some reason.

Further reading (the SANS bit was from their email newsletter):
https://www.theregister.com/2024/08/28/proofofconcept_code_released_for_zeroclick/?is=1ef7934f6635b02395adcab09a0c1b24bf0ea745b648bfe87189de8aadc7300b

https://malwaretech.com/2024/08/exploiting-CVE-2024-38063.html

##
Sempf@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T03:33:59.000Z ##

Anyone played with this MS IPv6 bug POC? I don't know a lot about the network stack, being mostly a web guy, but the code is nice and elegant.

https://github.com/ynwarcs/CVE-2024-38063/tree/main

##

CVE-2024-43044
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-16T18:33:08

5 posts

Jenkins uses the Remoting library (typically `agent.jar` or `remoting.jar`) for the communication between controller and agents. This library allows agents to load classes and classloader resources from the controller, so that Java objects sent from the controller (build steps, etc.) can be executed on agents. In addition to individual class and resource files, Remoting also allows Jenkins plugin

4 repos

https://github.com/convisolabs/CVE-2024-43044-jenkins

https://github.com/v9d0g/CVE-2024-43044-POC

https://github.com/HwMex0/CVE-2024-43044

https://github.com/jenkinsci-cert/SECURITY-3430

screaminggoat at 2024-09-02T14:22:08.324Z ##

When it comes to a vulnerability's exploitability, a proof of concept being disclosed increases those odds. Does every CVE with a PoC get exploited? Definitely not. In this case however, a cybercriminal recently shared a Proof of Concept (PoC) on a dark web forum for CVE-2024-43044, a Jenkins server arbitrary file read vulnerability (See parent toot above for the security advisory). Threat actors talking about exploiting a vulnerability adds a bit more weight to the exploitability odds.

There's a technical analysis and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-43044 if you wanted to learn more.

cc: @todb

#jenkins #CVE_2024_43033 #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-02T08:38:59.962Z ##

Update: Exploits for CVE-2024-43044 : Path Transversal vulnerability in Jenkins is available publicly. IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

Link:
https://github.com/convisolabs/CVE-2024-43044-jenkins?tab=readme-ov-file

https://blog.convisoappsec.com/en/analysis-of-cve-2024-43044/

##

CVE-2024-7262
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-16T15:32:48

4 posts

Improper path validation in promecefpluginhost.exe in Kingsoft WPS Office version ranging from 12.2.0.13110 to 12.2.0.13489 on Windows allows an attacker to load an arbitrary Windows library. Using the MHTML format allows an attacker to automatically deliver a malicious library on opening the document and a single user click on a crafted hyperlink leads to the execution of the library.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T14:57:44.725Z ##

ESET Research: Analysis of two arbitrary code execution vulnerabilities affecting WPS Office
No surprise that software vendor Kingsoft does not want to disclose in-the-wild zero-day exploitation of CVE-2024-7672 (9.3 critical, published 15 August 2024 and silently patched by Kingsoft sometime March 2024) WPS Office arbitrary code execution via path traversal (!!! cc: @cR0w @reverseics). It is being exploited by a South Korea-aligned Advanced Persistent Threat, called APT-C-60, to target East Asian countries. The final payload is a custom backdoor dubbed SpyGlace. ESET also discovered CVE-2024-7263 (9.3 critical, same info as previous 7262 CVE), which is an alternate method of hijacking the control flow of the same WPS Office plugin component. IOC provided.

See related The Hacker News reporting: APT-C-60 Group Exploit WPS Office Flaw to Deploy SpyGlace Backdoor

#threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_72762 #CVE_2024_72763 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #cyberespionage #southkorea #APTC60 #IOC

The patch released in version 12.2.0.16909 to mitigate CVE-2024-7262 was not restrictive enough. Another hyperlink parameter was not properly sanitized which leads to the execution of an arbitrary Windows lib

CVE-2024-29857
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-15T21:38:17

2 posts

An issue was discovered in ECCurve.java and ECCurve.cs in Bouncy Castle Java (BC Java) before 1.78, BC Java LTS before 2.73.6, BC-FJA before 1.0.2.5, and BC C# .Net before 2.3.1. Importing an EC certificate with crafted F2m parameters can lead to excessive CPU consumption during the evaluation of the curve parameters.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-4671
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-08-14T17:06:43.910000

2 posts

Use after free in Visuals in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.201 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-29T13:31:26.914Z ##

Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) State-backed attackers and commercial surveillance vendors repeatedly use the same exploits
Google TAG observed multiple in-the-wild exploit campaigns, between November 2023 and July 2024, delivered from a watering hole attack on Mongolian government websites. They assess with moderate confidence the campaigns are linked to the Russian government-backed actor APT29. In each iteration of the watering hole campaigns, the attackers used exploits that were identical or strikingly similar to exploits previously used by commercial surveillance vendors (CSVs) Intellexa and NSO Group. Google TAG provides a timeline of the watering hole attack, Apple Safari campaign, Google Chrome campaign, and the Exploit reuse timeline. IOC provided.

APT29, aka Midnight Blizzard and Cozy Bear, is publicly attributed to Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the U.S. Government.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Russian APT29 hackers use iOS, Chrome exploits created by spyware vendors

#googletag #apt29 #Russia #cyberespionage #threatintel #infosec #IOC #intellexa #nsogroup #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2024_5274 #CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2021_1879 #CVE_2021_37973

##

CVE-2024-38178
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.30%

updated 2024-08-14T16:34:46.337000

2 posts

Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.936Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

Notes:

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.
  • Besides CVE-2024-7971, I skipped mentioning 19 other vulnerabilities that Google publicly announced yesterday.
  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_38208 #CVE_2024_38209 #CVE_2024_38210 #CVE_2024_43477 #CVE_2024_7971 #CVE_2024_38178 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #northkorea #cyberespionage

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T00:06:24.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38208 (6.1 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: Unknown if publicly disclosed since it's not populated)
  • CVE-2024-38209 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38210 (7.8 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-41879 (score pending) Adobe: CVE-2024-41879 Adobe PDF Viewer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-43477 (7.5 high) Entra ID Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (Note: The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve)
  • CVE-2024-7971 Chromium: CVE-2024-7971 Type confusion in V8
    • Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-7971 exists in the wild.
  • CVE-2024-38178 (7.5 high, disclosed 13 August 2024 as an exploited zero-day) Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability (updated the acknowledgements only)

  • Microsoft Edge has been updated to version 128.0.2739.42, which is based on Chromium version 128.0.6613.84/.85. This includes patching against the actively exploited zero-day CVE-2024-7971.

  • It's worth noting that Microsoft credited AhnLab and National Cyber Security Center (NCSC), Republic of Korea for reporting CVE-2024-38178. AhnLab Security Emergency Response Center (ASEC) has historically tracked various North Korean state-sponsored APTs such as Kimsuky, Reaper (Scarcruft), Andariel, and Lazarus. This is speculation but it's likely that CVE-2024-38178 was exploited by North Korean APTs, even though it's not their usual flavor of zero-day vulnerabilities (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver).

CVE-2023-38831
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 31.24%

updated 2024-08-14T15:31:10

2 posts

RARLabs WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to ac

49 repos

https://github.com/kehrijksen/CVE-2023-38831

https://github.com/MyStuffYT/CVE-2023-38831-POC

https://github.com/ameerpornillos/CVE-2023-38831-WinRAR-Exploit

https://github.com/K3rnel-Dev/WinrarExploit

https://github.com/BeniB3astt/CVE-2023-38831_ReverseShell_Winrar

https://github.com/youmulijiang/evil-winrar

screaminggoat at 2024-09-02T13:32:45.168Z ##

Kaspersky: Head Mare: adventures of a unicorn in Russia and Belarus
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as exploited in the wild by cybercriminals, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability.

So Head Mare is a hacktivist group that's been active since 2023 and exclusively targets companies in Russia and Belarus. (sus) They conduct phishing campaigns distributing RAR archives that leverage CVE-2023-38831 for initial acess. Some of the discovered tools overlap with previously investigated groups attacking Russian organizations. They deploy LockBit for Windows and Babuk for Linux (ESXi) ransomware. Indicators of compromise provided.

CVE-2024-7272
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.12%

updated 2024-08-13T15:31:34

4 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in FFmpeg up to 5.1.5. This affects the function fill_audiodata of the file /libswresample/swresample.c. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. This issue was fixed in version 6.0 by 9903ba28c28ab18dc7b7b6fb8571cc8b5caae1a6 but a backport for 5.1 was forgotten. The exploit ha

CVE-2024-42474
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T18:57:17.383000

2 posts

Streamlit is a data oriented application development framework for python. Snowflake Streamlit open source addressed a security vulnerability via the static file sharing feature. Users of hosted Streamlit app(s) on Windows were vulnerable to a path traversal vulnerability when the static file sharing feature is enabled. An attacker could utilize the vulnerability to leak the password hash of the W

screaminggoat at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.074Z ##

Horizon3: NTLM Credential Theft in Python Windows Applications
NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF). Horizon3 covers SSRF vulnerabilities leading to NTLMv2 hash disclosure in three of the most popular Python frameworks out there: Gradio by Hugging Face, which powers several popular AI tools; Jupyter Server, which underpins Jupyter Notebook and JupyterLab; and Streamlit from Snowflake.

  • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

#Gradio #Streamlit #Jupyter #vulnerability #CVE_2024_34510 #CVE_2024_35178 #CVE_2024_42474 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-23T13:56:45.000Z ##

NTLMv2 hash theft is possible on Windows hosts through the exploitation of Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF).   • CVE-2024-34510 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Gradio)
  • CVE-2024-35178 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Jupyter Server)
  • CVE-2024-42474 (NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure in Streamlit)

The vulnerabilities disclosed here relate to how these Python frameworks retrieve files. Specifically, in Python, any file system operation performed on insufficiently validated input can lead to the leakage of NTLMv2 hashes, and can be exploited by unauthenticated attackers.

(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.41%

updated 2024-08-08T15:31:27

4 posts

VMware ESXi contains an authentication bypass vulnerability. A malicious actor with sufficient Active Directory (AD) permissions can gain full access to an ESXi host that was previously configured to use AD for user management https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2012/09/joining-vsphere-hosts-to-active-directory.html by re-creating the configured AD group ('ESXi Admins' by default) after it was dele

threatcodex at 2024-08-28T18:07:03.670Z ##

BlackByte blends tried-and-true tradecraft with newly disclosed vulnerabilities to support ongoing attacks
#BlackByte #CVE_2024_37085
https://blog.talosintelligence.com/blackbyte-blends-tried-and-true-tradecraft-with-newly-disclosed-vulnerabilities-to-support-ongoing-attacks/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-28T13:45:17.719Z ##

Cisco Talos: BlackByte blends tried-and-true tradecraft with newly disclosed vulnerabilities to support ongoing attacks
Reference: CVE-2024-37085 (7.2 high, disclosed 25 June 2024 by Broadcom, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 30 July 2024) VMware ESXi Authentication Bypass Vulnerability.

BlackByte is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group believed to be an offshoot of the Conti ransomware group. They continue leveraging tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) such as the use of vulnerable drivers (BYOVD) to bypass security protections. They also exploited CVE-2024-37085 shortly after it was disclosed. Cisco highlights a change in the ransomware encryptor that appends “blackbytent_h” file extension to encrypted files (previously unreported), drops four vulnerable driver files now, and uses victim Active Directory credentials to self-propagate. The BlackByte group is also probably more active than its data leak site may imply (only 20-30% of victims have an extortion post). Cisco has recommendations and IOC.

See related The Hacker News reporting: BlackByte Ransomware Exploits VMware ESXi Flaw in Latest Attack Wave

#threatintel #blackbyte #ransomware #raas #conti #CVE_2024_37085 #eitw #IOC #byovd

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-28T13:45:17.000Z ##

They continue leveraging tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) such as the use of vulnerable drivers (BYOVD) to bypass security protections. They also exploited CVE-2024-37085 shortly after it was disclosed. ##

CVE-2024-38206
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-07T00:30:52

1 posts

An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T14:38:12.000Z ##

Tenable: SSRFing the Web with the help of Copilot Studio
See parent toot above for the initial security advisory.
Tenable provides a technical analysis of CVE-2024-38206 (Microsoft considers it a 8.5 high, NVD evaluated it as 6.5 medium) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability. They leveraged Copilot's ability to make external web requests in a server-side request forgery (SSRF). Coupled with an SSRF protection bypass, Tenable researchers were able to get access to Microsoft's internal infrastructure for Copilot Studio, including the Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) and internal Cosmos DB instances. This included access to potentially sensitive information regarding service internals with potential cross-tenant impact. They noted that the infrastructure used for this Copilot Studio service was shared among tenants. Any impact on that infrastructure could affect multiple customers.

#CVE_2024_38206 #SSRF #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #CopilotStudio #copilot

##

CVE-2024-37018
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-05T18:32:49

2 posts

The OpenDaylight 0.15.3 controller allows topology poisoning via API requests because an application can manipulate the path that is taken by discovery packets.

arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-09-02T06:53:07.000Z ##

Manipulating OpenFlow Link Discovery Packet Forwarding for Topology Poisoning

Mingming Chen, Thomas La Porta, Teryl Taylor, Frederico Araujo, Trent Jaeger
https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/html/2408.16940

arXiv:2408.16940v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a centralized, dynamic, and programmable network management technology that enables flexible traffic control and scalability. SDN facilitates network administration through a centralized view of the underlying physical topology; tampering with this topology view can result in catastrophic damage to network management and security. To underscore this issue, we introduce Marionette, a new topology poisoning technique that manipulates OpenFlow link discovery packet forwarding to alter topology information. Our approach exposes an overlooked yet widespread attack vector, distinguishing itself from traditional link fabrication attacks that tamper, spoof, or relay discovery packets at the data plane. Unlike localized attacks observed in existing methods, our technique introduces a globalized topology poisoning attack that leverages control privileges. Marionette implements a reinforcement learning algorithm to compute a poisoned topology target, and injects flow entries to achieve a long-lived stealthy attack. Our evaluation shows that Marionette successfully attacks five open-source controllers and nine OpenFlow-based discovery protocols. Marionette overcomes the state-of-the-art topology poisoning defenses, showcasing a new class of topology poisoning that initiates on the control plane. This security vulnerability was ethically disclosed to OpenDaylight, and CVE-2024-37018 has been assigned.

##
arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-09-02T06:53:07.000Z ##

Manipulating OpenFlow Link Discovery Packet Forwarding for Topology Poisoning

Mingming Chen, Thomas La Porta, Teryl Taylor, Frederico Araujo, Trent Jaeger
https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/html/2408.16940

arXiv:2408.16940v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a centralized, dynamic, and programmable network management technology that enables flexible traffic control and scalability. SDN facilitates network administration through a centralized view of the underlying physical topology; tampering with this topology view can result in catastrophic damage to network management and security. To underscore this issue, we introduce Marionette, a new topology poisoning technique that manipulates OpenFlow link discovery packet forwarding to alter topology information. Our approach exposes an overlooked yet widespread attack vector, distinguishing itself from traditional link fabrication attacks that tamper, spoof, or relay discovery packets at the data plane. Unlike localized attacks observed in existing methods, our technique introduces a globalized topology poisoning attack that leverages control privileges. Marionette implements a reinforcement learning algorithm to compute a poisoned topology target, and injects flow entries to achieve a long-lived stealthy attack. Our evaluation shows that Marionette successfully attacks five open-source controllers and nine OpenFlow-based discovery protocols. Marionette overcomes the state-of-the-art topology poisoning defenses, showcasing a new class of topology poisoning that initiates on the control plane. This security vulnerability was ethically disclosed to OpenDaylight, and CVE-2024-37018 has been assigned.

##

CVE-2020-19909
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-04T15:15:27.830000

2 posts

Integer overflow vulnerability in tool_operate.c in curl 7.65.2 via a large value as the retry delay. NOTE: many parties report that this has no direct security impact on the curl user; however, it may (in theory) cause a denial of service to associated systems or networks if, for example, --retry-delay is misinterpreted as a value much smaller than what was intended. This is not especially plausi

1 repos

#search_error

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-08-26T07:46:13.000Z ##

Last year on this day the bogus #curl CVE arrived that triggered a series of events that subsequently made #curl become a CNA.

https://daniel.haxx.se/blog/2023/08/26/cve-2020-19909-is-everything-that-is-wrong-with-cves/

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-08-26T07:46:13.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-34750
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-04T05:01:04

2 posts

Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. When processing an HTTP/2 stream, Tomcat did not handle some cases of excessive HTTP headers correctly. This led to a miscounting of active HTTP/2 streams which in turn led to the use of an incorrect infinite timeout which allowed connections to remain open which should have been closed.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.647Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-21T15:29:05.000Z ##

Atlassian security advisory: Security Bulletin - August 20 2024

  • Bamboo Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-21689 (7.6 High) RCE
    • CVE-2024-29857 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Confluence Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
    • CVE-2024-21690 (7.1 high) Reflected XSS and CSRF
  • Crowd Data Center and Server
    • CVE-2024-22259 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22243 (8.1 high) SSRF
    • CVE-2024-22262 (8.1 high) SSRF
  • Jira Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS
  • Jira Service Management Data Center and Server:
    • CVE-2024-34750 (7.5 high) DoS

CVE-2024-34750 is an Apache tomcat-coyote dependency vulnerability affecting multiple products, hence the duplicate entries. At a glance, no mention of exploitation.

#Atlassian #PatchTuesday #Vulnerability #CVE #bamboo #Confluence

##

CVE-2024-27275
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T21:32:46

2 posts

IBM i 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, and 7.5 contains a local privilege escalation vulnerability caused by an insufficient authority requirement. A local user without administrator privilege can configure a physical file trigger to execute with the privileges of a user socially engineered to access the target file. The correction is to require administrator privilege to configure trigger support. IBM X-Force ID:

silentsignal at 2024-08-27T07:11:55.196Z ##

IBM issued a fix to CVE-2024-27275 that mitigates an #IBMi privilege escalation technique we published last year:

🥷https://blog.silentsignal.eu/2023/03/30/booby-trapping-ibm-i/
🧑‍🏭https://ibm.com/support/pages/node/7157637

The PTF restricts the use of the ADDPFTRG command - this is a breaking change documented in the Memo to Users.

##
silentsignal@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-27T07:11:55.000Z ##

IBM issued a fix to CVE-2024-27275 that mitigates an #IBMi privilege escalation technique we published last year:

🥷https://blog.silentsignal.eu/2023/03/30/booby-trapping-ibm-i/
🧑‍🏭https://ibm.com/support/pages/node/7157637

The PTF restricts the use of the ADDPFTRG command - this is a breaking change documented in the Memo to Users.

##

CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 71.47%

updated 2024-07-30T03:31:55

2 posts

A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #cve

Cisco security advisories for today 21 August 2024:

  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Denial of Service Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20375 (8.6 high)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine REST API Blind SQL Injection Vulnerabilities
    CVE-2024-20417 (6.5 medium) (Note: not fixed, migrate off to a fixed release lolz)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Sensitive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20466 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20486 (6.5 medium)
  • Cisco Unified Communications Manager Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20488 (6.1 medium)

Bonus: Cisco updated the vulnerable products list for CVE-2024-6387 Remote Unauthenticated Code Execution Vulnerability in OpenSSH Server (aka #regreSSHion)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

##

CVE-2021-37973
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.62%

updated 2024-07-26T19:39:05.947000

4 posts

Use after free in Portals in Google Chrome prior to 94.0.4606.61 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-29T13:31:26.914Z ##

Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) State-backed attackers and commercial surveillance vendors repeatedly use the same exploits
Google TAG observed multiple in-the-wild exploit campaigns, between November 2023 and July 2024, delivered from a watering hole attack on Mongolian government websites. They assess with moderate confidence the campaigns are linked to the Russian government-backed actor APT29. In each iteration of the watering hole campaigns, the attackers used exploits that were identical or strikingly similar to exploits previously used by commercial surveillance vendors (CSVs) Intellexa and NSO Group. Google TAG provides a timeline of the watering hole attack, Apple Safari campaign, Google Chrome campaign, and the Exploit reuse timeline. IOC provided.

APT29, aka Midnight Blizzard and Cozy Bear, is publicly attributed to Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the U.S. Government.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Russian APT29 hackers use iOS, Chrome exploits created by spyware vendors

#googletag #apt29 #Russia #cyberespionage #threatintel #infosec #IOC #intellexa #nsogroup #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2024_5274 #CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2021_1879 #CVE_2021_37973

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-29T13:31:26.000Z ##

In each iteration of the watering hole campaigns, the attackers used exploits that were identical or strikingly similar to exploits previously used by commercial surveillance vendors (CSVs) Intellexa and NSO Group. APT29, aka Midnight Blizzard and Cozy Bear, is publicly attributed to Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the U.S. Government.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: Russian APT29 hackers use iOS, Chrome exploits created by spyware vendors

Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) State-backed attackers and commercial surveillance vendors repeatedly use the same exploits
Google TAG observed multiple in-the-wild exploit campaigns, between November 2023 and July 2024, delivered from a watering hole attack on Mongolian government websites. They assess with moderate confidence the campaigns are linked to the Russian government-backed actor APT29. In each iteration of the watering hole campaigns, the attackers used exploits that were identical or strikingly similar to exploits previously used by commercial surveillance vendors (CSVs) Intellexa and NSO Group. #googletag #apt29 #Russia #cyberespionage #threatintel #infosec #IOC #intellexa #nsogroup #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2024_5274 #CVE_2024_4671 #CVE_2023_41993 #CVE_2021_1879 #CVE_2021_37973

##

CVE-2019-1003030
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 8.98%

updated 2024-07-16T20:28:14

1 posts

A sandbox bypass vulnerability exists in Jenkins Pipeline: Groovy Plugin 2.63 and earlier in pom.xml, src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/workflow/cps/CpsGroovyShell.java that allows attackers able to control pipeline scripts to execute arbitrary code on the Jenkins master JVM.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-20T15:39:20.000Z ##

Just FYI, CISA quietly updated a column for CVE-2024-23897 in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog:

Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known

See parent toots above for information on the Jenkins Command Line Interface (CLI) Path Traversal Vulnerability.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-23897:

  • CISA confirmed that CVE-2024-23897 is a Known Exploited Vulnerability today and added it to the KEV Catalog.
  • It's had a Proof of Concept since at least 4 days after the security advisory.
  • Jenkins is an attractive target for threat actors. Four other Jenkins vulnerabilities are in CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2015-5317, CVE-2019-1003029, CVE-2019-1003030 and CVE-2018-1000861.
  • It's already had exploitation attempts since 25 January 2024
  • Trend Micro also noted active exploitation on 19 March 2024. See Recent attacks section.
  • CloudSEK noted on 25 July 2024 that threat actor IntelBroker exploited CVE-2024-23897 to breach BORN Group's systems, exfiltrating sensitive data from multiple clients.
  • Ransomware groups have been known to exploit it: Juniper said on 13 August 2024 that RansomEXX leveraged CVE-2024-23897 to gain initial unauthorized access to Brontoo Technology Solutions.

#CVE_2024_23897 #vulnerability #cve #Jenkins #kev #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware

##

CVE-2024-5535
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T15:31:25

2 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

screaminggoat at 2024-08-22T18:21:35.893Z ##

Palo Alto Networks security advisory: CVE-2024-5535 Informational Bulletin: Impact of OpenSSL Vulnerability CVE-2024-5535
It's okay to put down your lampshades: Palo Alto Networks products are not affected by CVE-2024-5535 (interestingly CISA-ADP scored 9.1 critical) OpenSSL sensitive information disclosure. "Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue."

@cadey "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens

#CVE_2024_5535 #PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE #OpenSSL
